Inuit Circumpolar Council Canada To support and enable the Inuit to guide and direct the future management of critical marine habitats in the North water polynya, an ice-free region between Greenland and Nunavut. This region has been important to the Inuit for generations and represents a globally significant area of marine productivity. The project will also support Inuit participation in a variety of policy forms and decision-making processes related to Arctic marine areas at local, regional and international scales. 350'000.00 Canada Environment Marine 2016 36 months (1 Apr 2016-01.04.2019)

This information will be used to build the evidence for prevention of violence against children and women. The Sexual Violence Research Initiative (SVRI) is a global programme hosted by the Medical Research Council of South Africa. As knowledge managers in the field, the SVRI gathers, develops, distils and disseminates knowledge to strengthen prevention of and response for sexual violence and related types of violence in low and middle income countries. 602'680.00 Worldwide Prevent Child Sexual Abuse Preventing violence, protecting children 2016 36 months (1 Sep 2016-31 Aug 2019)
Memoria Abierta To strengthen Memoria Abiertas role regionally and internationally by sharing its expertise with communities who have experienced gross violations of human rights. Based in Buenos Aires, Memoria Abierta preserves and disseminates documentation of abuses perpetrated by the military dictatorship in Argentina. It builds support for accountability processes and helps victims achieve social recognition of crimes. 717'807.00 Argentina International Human Rights Ending impunity for gross human rights violations 2017 47 months (01 Sep 2017-31 Aug 2021)
Mercy Ships To support the outfitting of a hospital on Global Mercy, a new ship which will serve patients in Africa. This new ship will more than double the capacity of the organisation Mercy Ships to deliver life-saving and life-changing surgery to patients and training for medical practitioners in host nations. The ship will serve patients who would otherwise lack access to safe, free healthcare. 5'000'000.00 Worldwide Special Interest 2018 23 months (1 Aug 2018-31 Jul 2020)
Mermaid Projektet To support the Mermaid III project in Denmark to develop methods to diagnose ovarian cancer at the earliest possible stage. Mermaid Projektet was founded in 2002 to initiate and finance ground breaking international projects in gynaecological cancer research. The project will be conducted in Denmark, in collaboration with international players, and will take advantage of the extraordinary Danish health data available through the health registers and biobanks. 1'491'257.00 Worldwide Special Interest 2014 56 months (1 Apr 2015-31.12.2019)

Miracle Feet To provide core support to MiracleFeet to enable it to continue its work in existing partner countries and to expand into new countries to reach and treat more children born with clubfoot. MiracleFeet has a proven programme model and track record in increasing access to proper treatment for children born with clubfoot in developing countries through partnerships with local healthcare providers. MiracleFeet envisions a world where all children born with clubfoot can live productive, active and healthy lives. It aims to eradicate untreated clubfoot globally. 5'000'000.00 United States Special Interest 2017 59 months (01 Apr 2017-31 Mar 2022)
